title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Memorial Health System (New York, NY) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the practice manager. Be aware they will offer 40 hour weeks but you will be required to work 55 to 60 hour weeks. Plan ahead for this.
Interview Questions: How well can you handle fast paced environments?

title: Accreditation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Health System (Marietta, OH) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Smooth interview process. Contacted by HR who then reviewed requirements of the job and asked to schedule an interview with the director of the department. Met with the director a few days later in person. Few days later HR called back with an offer
Interview Questions: Are you fluent in ACGME terminology?

title: Cardiac Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Health System
Interview Descriptions: Spoke in HR briefly, then same day talked with head of the department and her boss. Then scanned a little, showed off my skills, then discussed next steps in proceeding with the offer.
Interview Questions: When did you go above and beyond for a patient?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Health System
Interview Descriptions: Applied Online. Got a call the next day and went in for an interview the next week. HR Manager is very easy to talk to. Asked multiple behavioral and situational questions.

title: Director Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Health System in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied on company website and completed online assessment. Then completed 30 minute phone interview. Then called in for in-person interview (1 hour). Quick and easy process. Would apply again in future.
Interview Questions: What about you makes you believe you would succeed in this role?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Health System (Marietta, OH) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for 2 Applications Analyst positions with two different departments. The first took a month to get back to me about an interview. Then I did 2 in-person interviews and then never heard back from the supervisor. The other position I applied for and received invitation for an interview the next day. I went in for a 45 min. interview and then was told I'd be contacted by HR on whether I got the job or not. Less than 2 weeks later I received an offer.
Interview Questions: They mostly asked about my education and work history.

title: Practice Management IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Health System
Interview Descriptions:
2 step interview process:
Step 1: Phone interview. This is a talent plus interview so you can find the questions for that online.

Step 2: In-person interview. This is not standard so varies by department. It was pretty easy and laid back!
Interview Questions: What is your least favorite state?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Health System (Telephone, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: One-way phone call, ask question and answer, ask question and answer. No back and forth or discussion/ conversation. A somewhat discomforting and off-putting way of screening applicants. The HR rep was friendly enough, very much in fact, it was just the process and method that I found odd.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict between staff members?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Health System in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an online application.  Within two days of receipt of my application, I received a call requesting a phone interview.  The appointment for the phone interview was set for later that week.  The phone interview consisted of a series of questions over a 45 minute period.  Following my phone interview, I was informed that my application would be forwarded to the department heads of the units of which I was interested.  Within two weeks, I had interviews with two different department heads.  Within two weeks, I received a call offering me both positions.
Interview Questions: How does flow affect your nursing day?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Health System (Marietta, OH) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and didn't hear anything for another month. I was then offered a group/panel interview that took about 40 min and consisted of scenario questions and how I would handle those situations as well as why did I want to work there, my experience, etc. Then there was also a shadow day where I got paid to follow a nurse around on the floor to see if I would like that particular floor and if they liked me. There was also a phone interview with more standard interview questions. Had I accepted the job then they would've done a drug test and background check but I didn't make it that far. This whole process took over 2 months which was very frustrating.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?
